INTJ.title: The Strategic Architect
INTJ.oneLiner: A future-focused strategist who prefers deep thinking, independence, and building systems that work.
strengths: Clear standards and principled problem solving
watchOuts: May appear blunt or distant when stressed
Can neglect emotional signals or social maintenance

career.motivators: Complex problems, autonomy, intellectual challenge, measurable impact.
career.environments: High trust, low politics, strong competence culture; room for long-term work.
career.roles: Research/engineering, systems design, data/ML, strategy, product architecture, technical leadership.
career.tips: Build feedback loops for people-impact (stakeholder check-ins; empathy rituals).

relationships.conflict: May default to 'fixing' rather than validating.
relationships.helps: Start with validation, then solutions: 'That makes sense. Want comfort or a plan?'

INTJ.social: Often prefers fewer, deeper relationships; energizes with ideas and purpose.

INTP.title: The Conceptual Analyst
INTP.oneLiner: An idea-driven analyst who prefers understanding how things work, with lots of mental freedom.
watchOuts: Can get stuck in analysis; difficulty finishing
May under-communicate feelings or needs

career.environments: Flexible structures, research time, minimal micromanagement.
career.tips: Use lightweight execution systems: milestones, accountability partner, shipping rituals.

relationships.conflict: Can intellectualize; partner may feel unseen.
relationships.helps: Reflect feelings in simple language before analyzing.

INTP.social: Often prefers small groups and long-form conversation.

ENTJ.title: The Systems Commander
ENTJ.oneLiner: A decisive organizer who prefers leading, optimizing systems, and pursuing ambitious goals.
watchOuts: Can over-prioritize results over relationships
May push pace too hard for others

career.motivators: Ownership, responsibility, scaling impact, measurable outcomes.
career.environments: Authority aligned with responsibility; clear goals and autonomy.
career.tips: Add 'people metrics': retention, psychological safety, stakeholder satisfaction.

relationships.conflict: May treat conflict as a problem to solve quickly.
relationships.helps: Make room for emotions as data; slow down for repair conversations.

ENTJ.social: Often networks strategically; prefers purposeful social time.

stressGrowth.growthEdge: Empathy, rest, and letting others lead.

ENTP.title: The Inventive Debater
ENTP.oneLiner: A fast-thinking explorer who prefers novelty, debate, and discovering new angles on ideas.
strengths: Plays with possibilities; energized by change
watchOuts: May start more than they finish
Debate style can accidentally feel personal

career.roles: Entrepreneurship, product innovation, marketing strategy, consulting, R&D.
career.tips: Use constraints: deadlines, scope limits, 'one project at a time' rules.

relationships.conflict: Can argue for fun while partner experiences it as conflict.
relationships.helps: Ask consent for debate: 'Brainstorm mode or support mode?'

ENTP.social: Often wide circles; thrives in lively conversation.

stressGrowth.growthEdge: Commitment, routine, and deeper emotional presence.

INFJ.title: The Insightful Advocate
INFJ.oneLiner: An insight-driven idealist who prefers depth, meaning, and purposeful contribution.
strengths: Deep empathy combined with pattern insight about people
watchOuts: Over-responsibility for others
Perfectionism; burnout when ideals meet messy reality

career.motivators: Meaning, growth, improving systems for humans, autonomy + trust.
career.environments: Mission-driven orgs, research/strategy roles with impact, supportive culture.
career.roles: Counseling/coaching, education, research, writing, product/user research, org development.

relationships.values: Depth, loyalty, emotional honesty, shared meaning.
relationships.conflict: May withdraw if misunderstood; may overthink.
relationships.helps: Direct needs language + reassurance; don't rely on hints.

INFJ.social: Often small circles; prefers deep conversation over frequent casual contact.

INFP.title: The Values-Centered Idealist
INFP.oneLiner: A gentle idealist who prefers authenticity, personal meaning, and exploring possibilities.
watchOuts: Can struggle with structure, deadlines, or impersonal criticism
May delay decisions to keep options open

career.motivators: Meaning, autonomy, creative expression, humane culture.
career.environments: Flexible roles with mission alignment; supportive feedback.
career.roles: Writing/design/creative work, helping roles (education, counseling, community work).
career.tips: Use gentle structure: weekly planning, time-boxing, 'minimum viable completion.'

relationships.conflict: Avoidance then sudden intensity if values feel threatened.
relationships.helps: Normalize conflict as repair; use clear requests.

INFP.social: Often selective; prefers a few intimate bonds.

ENFJ.title: The Growth-Oriented Organizer
ENFJ.oneLiner: A relational leader who prefers guiding people toward growth and building harmony.
watchOuts: Overextension and people-pleasing
Difficulty tolerating conflict or disappointment

career.environments: Collaborative orgs, education, people operations, community roles.
career.roles: Teaching/training, HR/people leadership, coaching, program management.
career.tips: Practice saying 'no' and protecting deep work time.

relationships.conflict: May manage emotions too much; can become resentful.
relationships.helps: Ask directly for needs; allow others to carry responsibility.

ENFJ.social: Often broad networks; enjoys hosting and connecting people.

ENFP.title: The Possibility Catalyst
ENFP.oneLiner: A high-energy explorer of people and ideas who prefers novelty, meaning, and freedom.
watchOuts: Can scatter attention; struggles with routine
May chase novelty when anxious

career.environments: Dynamic teams; roles with ideation + relationship-building.
career.roles: Product/marketing/communications, community building, coaching, education, entrepreneurship.
career.tips: Use simple systems: one priority per quarter, weekly review, finish rituals.

relationships.conflict: Can over-interpret signals; needs reassurance and clarity.
relationships.helps: Direct communication + shared plans that still allow spontaneity.

ENFP.social: Often wide circles; needs decompression time after intense social output.

stressGrowth.stressSigns: Overcommitment, anxiety spirals, avoidance of boring tasks.

ISTJ.title: The Dependable Logistician
ISTJ.oneLiner: A steady, detail-aware planner who prefers clarity, responsibility, and proven methods.
watchOuts: Can be rigid under stress
May undervalue novelty or ambiguous ideas

career.motivators: Clear expectations, stable systems, measurable quality.
career.environments: Structured roles, clear authority, high trust in competence.
career.roles: Operations, finance/accounting, engineering with procedures, compliance.
career.tips: Schedule small experiments; practice curiosity about alternative approaches.

relationships.helps: Translate standards into needs: 'I feel safe when weâ€¦'

ISTJ.social: Often prefers a smaller, long-term circle; shows care through practical support.

ISFJ.title: The Supportive Protector
ISFJ.oneLiner: A caring stabilizer who prefers helping through service, details, and consistency.
strengths: Warm reliability; remembers what matters to people
watchOuts: Overgiving; difficulty saying no
Takes criticism personally

career.motivators: Helping others concretely; stable routines; appreciation.
career.environments: Supportive teams, predictable operations, clear roles.
career.roles: Healthcare support, education support, administration, quality roles.
career.tips: Build boundary habits: capacity limits, protected time.

relationships.helps: Make needs explicit early; normalize disagreement.

ISFJ.social: Often a 'quiet backbone' friend; shows up reliably.

ESTJ.title: The Practical Executive
ESTJ.oneLiner: A results-focused organizer who prefers structure, clarity, and getting things done.
strengths: Handles logistics and decisions under pressure
watchOuts: Can be blunt; may overlook emotional impact
Can overemphasize rules when flexibility is needed

career.motivators: Responsibility, authority aligned with accountability, clear KPIs.
career.environments: Structured orgs, operations-heavy contexts, leadership tracks.
career.tips: Add 'people check-ins' to avoid friction and improve retention.

relationships.helps: Validate feelings before solutions; soften tone.

ESTJ.social: Often community-oriented and organized; may take charge of group logistics.

ESFJ.title: The Harmonizing Contributor
ESFJ.oneLiner: A people-centered organizer who prefers harmony, belonging, and practical care.
watchOuts: Over-focus on approval
Can struggle with impersonal critique

career.motivators: Helping people, teamwork, appreciation, clear roles.
career.roles: People ops, education, healthcare coordination, customer success, events.

relationships.helps: Use direct requests; separate behavior from identity.

ESFJ.social: Often thrives in community; remembers details; creates traditions.

ISTP.title: The Troubleshooter
ISTP.oneLiner: A pragmatic problem solver who prefers autonomy, skill, and real-world experimentation.
watchOuts: Can disengage from long emotional processing
May avoid long-term commitment when it feels constraining

career.motivators: Real problems, tools/systems, autonomy, immediate feedback.
career.environments: Flexible workflows, competence-based trust, low bureaucracy.
career.tips: Build habits that scale: documentation, handoffs, proactive status updates.

relationships.values: Independence, loyalty, low drama, shared activities.
relationships.conflict: Partner may want more verbal reassurance.
relationships.helps: Use 'action + words': do the supportive act and say why it matters.

ISTP.social: Often prefers small groups and activity-based friendships.

ISFP.title: The Authentic Creator
ISFP.oneLiner: A gentle, values-led person who prefers authenticity, creative expression, and harmony.
watchOuts: Conflict avoidance; may not voice needs early
Sensitive to harsh critique or rigid control

career.motivators: Meaningful work, beauty/craft, autonomy, humane culture.
career.environments: Flexible structure; respectful feedback; room for individual style.
career.tips: Learn boundary scripts and direct requests.

relationships.conflict: Avoids escalation; may shut down if pushed.
relationships.helps: Use low-intensity conflict tools: 'When X happens, I feel Y; I need Z.'

ISFP.social: Often prefers smaller gatherings; bonds through shared experiences.

stressGrowth.stressSigns: Withdrawal, emotional flooding, 'going along' then resentment.

ESTP.title: The Action Improviser
ESTP.oneLiner: An energetic doer who prefers solving problems fast, adapting in real time, and learning on the fly.
strengths: Quick action and high situational awareness
watchOuts: Can underweight long-term consequences
Boredom with maintenance work

career.environments: Fast feedback loops; real-world stakes; room to move.
career.roles: Sales/BD, entrepreneurship, field operations, emergency roles, product iteration.
career.tips: Add reflection rituals: postmortems, long-term metrics, planning blocks.

relationships.conflict: Can escalate quickly or push for immediate resolution.

ESTP.social: Often thrives in groups; energizes the atmosphere.

ESFP.title: The Warm Energizer
ESFP.oneLiner: A friendly connector who prefers shared experiences, practical positivity, and bringing people together.
watchOuts: May avoid negative emotions or long-term planning
Can over-prioritize approval or excitement

career.environments: Social, active roles with real-time feedback.
career.roles: Hospitality/events, education, customer success, community work, sales, content creation.
career.tips: Simple planning tools: weekly review, budget, calendar rituals.

relationships.conflict: May want to 'move on' too quickly.
relationships.helps: Schedule short but regular serious conversations.

ESFP.social: Often broad circles; needs occasional quiet time despite social energy.
